title: Pilsner
summary: Pilsner (also pilsener or simply pils) is a type of pale lager. It takes its name from the Bohemian city of Plze≈à (Pilsen), where it was first produced in 1842 by Bavarian brewer Josef Groll.[1] The world's first pale lager, the original Pilsner Urquell,[2] is still produced there today.
